Submodules¶

jasmin_cloud.authentication module¶

Authentication helpers and backends for the jasmin_cloud Django app.

class jasmin_cloud.authentication.ProviderBackend¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.backends.ModelBackend

Authentication backend that uses the configured Provider for authentication.

We use the model backend, but rather than checking passwords in the database we use the provider. The authenticated UnscopedSession is saved in the session to be retrieved later.

authenticate(request, username=None, password=None, **kwargs)¶

jasmin_cloud.serializers module¶

Django REST framework serializers for the jasmin_cloud app.

These serializers marshall objects from the provider.dto package.

jasmin_cloud.settings module¶

Settings helpers for the jasmin_cloud Django app.

class jasmin_cloud.settings.JasminCloudSettings(name, user_settings)¶

Bases: jasmin_django_utils.appsettings.SettingsObject

Settings object for the JASMIN_CLOUD setting.

PROVIDER¶

Property descriptor for an ‘object factory’ setting of the form:

{
    'FACTORY': 'dotted.path.to.factory.function',
    'PARAMS': {
        'PARAM1': 'value for param 1',
    },
}

The FACTORY can either be a constructor or a dedicated factory function.

Keys in PARAMS are lower-cased and used as kwargs for the factory.

SSH_KEY_STORE¶

Property descriptor for an ‘object factory’ setting of the form:

{
    'FACTORY': 'dotted.path.to.factory.function',
    'PARAMS': {
        'PARAM1': 'value for param 1',
    },
}

The FACTORY can either be a constructor or a dedicated factory function.

Keys in PARAMS are lower-cased and used as kwargs for the factory.

jasmin_cloud.urls module¶

URL definitions for the jasmin_cloud Django app.

jasmin_cloud.views module¶

Django views for the jasmin_cloud app.

jasmin_cloud.views.get_view_description(view_cls, html=False)¶

Alternative django-rest-framework VIEW_DESCRIPTION_FUNCTION that allows RestructuredText to be used instead of Markdown.

This allows docstrings to be used in the DRF-generated HTML views and in Sphinx-generated API views.

jasmin_cloud.views.convert_provider_exceptions(view)¶

Decorator that converts errors from provider.errors into appropriate HTTP responses or Django REST framework errors.

jasmin_cloud.views.authenticate(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This view attempts to authenticate the user using the given username and password. If authentication is successful, a session is started for the user.

Example request payload:

{
    "username" : "jbloggs",
    "password" : "mysecurepassword"
}
jasmin_cloud.views.session(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return information about the current session.

On DELETE requests, destroy the current session.

jasmin_cloud.views.tenancies(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns the tenancies available to the authenticated user.

jasmin_cloud.views.quotas(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns information about the quotas available to the tenant.

jasmin_cloud.views.images(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns the images available to the specified tenancy.

The image attributes are:

  • id: The id of the image.
  • name: The human-readable name of the image.
  • is_public: Indicates if the image is public or private.
  • nat_allowed: Indicates if NAT is allowed for machines deployed from the image.
jasmin_cloud.views.image_details(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns the details for the specified image.

The image attributes are:

  • id: The id of the image.
  • name: The human-readable name of the image.
  • is_public: Indicates if the image is public or private.
  • nat_allowed: Indicates if NAT is allowed for machines deployed from the image.
jasmin_cloud.views.sizes(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns the machine sizes available to the specified tenancy.

The size attributes are:

  • id: The id of the size.
  • name: The human-readable name of the size.
  • cpus: The number of CPUs.
  • ram: The amount of RAM (in MB).
jasmin_cloud.views.size_details(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns the details for the specified machine size.

The size attributes are:

  • id: The id of the size.
  • name: The human-readable name of the size.
  • cpus: The number of CPUs.
  • ram: The amount of RAM (in MB).
jasmin_cloud.views.machines(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return the machines deployed in the specified tenancy.

On POST requests, create a new machine. The request body should look like:

{
    "name" : "test-machine",
    "image_id" : "<uuid of image>",
    "size_id" : "<id of size>"
}
jasmin_cloud.views.machine_details(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return the details for the specified machine.

On DELETE requests, delete the specified machine.

jasmin_cloud.views.machine_start(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Start (power on) the specified machine.

jasmin_cloud.views.machine_stop(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Stop (power off) the specified machine.

jasmin_cloud.views.machine_restart(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Restart (power cycle) the specified machine.

jasmin_cloud.views.external_ips(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return a list of external IP addresses that are allocated to the tenancy.

On POST requests, allocate a new external IP address for the tenancy from a pool. This functionality is not available for all providers. The request body is ignored. The returned response will be the allocated IP:

{
    "external_ip" : "172.28.128.4",
    "internal_ip" : null
}
jasmin_cloud.views.external_ip_details(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return the details for the external IP address.

On PUT requests, attach the specified machine to the external IP address. If the machine_id is null, the external IP address will be detached from the machine it is currently attached to. The request body should contain the machine ID:

{ "machine_id" : "<machine id>" }
jasmin_cloud.views.volumes(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return a list of the volumes for the tenancy.

On POST requests, create a new volume. The request body should look like:

{
    "name" : "volume-name",
    "size" : 20
}

The size of the volume is given in GB.

jasmin_cloud.views.volume_details(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

On GET requests, return the details for the specified volume.

On PUT requests, update the attachment status of the specified volume depending on the given machine_id.

To attach a volume to a machine, just give the machine id:

{ "machine_id" : "<uuid of machine>" }

To detach a volume, just give null as the the machine id:

{ "machine_id" : null }

On DELETE requests, delete the specified volume.
